Count drained streams now, but monitor non-drained streams.

trailingComments.value: If all streams were already drained, exit now.

leadingComments.value: If all streams were already drained, exit now.

trailingComments.value: In Windows, when run as a Node.js child process, a script utilizing
this library might just exit with a 0 exit code, regardless. This code,
despite the fact that it looks a bit crazy, appears to fix that.

leadingComments.value: In Windows, when run as a Node.js child process, a script utilizing
this library might just exit with a 0 exit code, regardless. This code,
despite the fact that it looks a bit crazy, appears to fix that.

comments.value:
* exit
 * https://github.com/cowboy/node-exit
 *
 * Copyright (c) 2013 "Cowboy" Ben Alman
 * Licensed under the MIT license.
Actually exit if all streams are drained.
Count drained streams now, but monitor non-drained streams.
If all streams were already drained, exit now.
In Windows, when run as a Node.js child process, a script utilizing
this library might just exit with a 0 exit code, regardless. This code,
despite the fact that it looks a bit crazy, appears to fix that.

tokens.value:
* exit
 * https://github.com/cowboy/node-exit
 *
 * Copyright (c) 2013 "Cowboy" Ben Alman
 * Licensed under the MIT license.
Actually exit if all streams are drained.
Count drained streams now, but monitor non-drained streams.
If all streams were already drained, exit now.
In Windows, when run as a Node.js child process, a script utilizing
this library might just exit with a 0 exit code, regardless. This code,
despite the fact that it looks a bit crazy, appears to fix that.
